definitions: To make a strenuous or unusually great effort.
To injure (a limb, muscle, etc.) by overexertion or twisting.
To subject to great pressure or tension.
To pour (a substance) through a sieve or similar device in order to separate out solid particles.
examples: He had to strain to hear the faint music.
She strained her back lifting the heavy box.
The constant demands strained their relationship.
Strain the pasta before adding the sauce.
